# Statistical software



## `GammaGateR`


## `mxnorm`

The `mxnorm` package includes tools to evaluate image normalization procedures for multiplexed immunofluorescence imaging.
  
## `pbj`

<div style= "float:left; width:17%">
<img src="images/pbj_rotate.png" alt="RESI" style="width:100%">
</div>
<!-- <img src="images/pbj_rotate.png" alt="pbj" style="float:left; width:17%"> -->
The `pbj` `R` package is a semiparametric bootstrap based joint inference procedure designed to do cluster-style inference for group-level neuroimage analysis. The latest version is currently available on [Github](https://github.com/statimagcoll/pbj) and can be installed from `R` using `devtools::install_github('statimagcoll/pbj')`.
The [pbj User's Guide](statimagcoll.github.io/pbjGuide) is a bookdown document describing the methods used in the `R` package and includes several analysis vignettes.

<br>
<br>

## `RESI`

<div style= "float:left; width:15%">
<img src="images/resi.png" alt="RESI" style="width:90%">
</div>
The `RESI` `R` package is available on CRAN by executing `install.packages('RESI')` and implements the robust effect size index in `R` by adding the index with nonparametric bootstrap confidence intervals to almost any coefficient or anova table. The package was developed and is maintained by Megan Jones. A preprint is available [here](https://arxiv.org/abs/2302.12345).

<br>
<br>
